New Records: DeMar DeRozan scored 34 points for the Kings, tying his career-high with a three-point play in overtime to give Sacramento the lead they wouldn't lose.
Domantas Sabonis recorded his ninth consecutive double-double with 20 points and 12 rebounds before fouling out in overtime.
Key Match Events: DeRozan scored the Kings' first eight points in overtime, setting the tone for the comeback win.
Keegan Murray tipped in his own missed shot with 3.9 seconds left in regulation to give Sacramento a one-point lead, which was maintained until Devin Booker's missed corner shot in overtime.
DeRozan's three-point play at the start of overtime was a pivotal moment that shifted momentum in favor of the Kings.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns played without Kevin Durant, who was injured Friday and will miss at least two weeks.
Rookie Ryan Dunn started in place of Durant, averaging 16 minutes per game entering Sunday.
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento snapped the Phoenix Suns' seven-game win streak with the overtime victory.
Bradley Beal led the Suns with 28 points, while Devin Booker contributed 23 points and 12 assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jusuf Nurkic was questionable for Sunday’s game with left ankle soreness but started and played 15 minutes before being ruled out at halftime.
Mason Plumlee, playing in Nurkic’s place, finished with six points, 11 rebounds, and six assists.
Others: The game was notable for the Kings' ability to overcome the Suns' strong performance and end their streak, highlighting the competitive nature of the NBA.
